metadata.title: CVE-2024-26667 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/msm/dpu: check for valid hw_pp in dpu_encoder_helper_phys_cleanup Thecommit 8b45a26f2ba9 ("drm/msm/dpu: reserve cdm blocks for writeback in caseof YUV output") introduced a smatch warning about another conditional blockin dpu_encoder_helper_phys_cleanup() which had assumed hw_pp will always bevalid which may not necessarily be true. Lets fix the other conditionalblock by making sure hw_pp is valid before dereferencing it. Patchwork:https://patchwork.freedesktop.org/patch/574878/

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26667` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2103-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2103.109
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2103-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2103.109
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
